author: Brian Tynes
title: Doctors say no amount of alcohol is safe during pregnancy
text:
(RNN) - Alcohol during pregnancy is a no-go.
The American Academy of Pediatrics released a report analyzing the correlation between pregnant women who consume alcohol and risk of birth defects, and concluded that there is no amount of alcohol is safe .
Routine drinking during pregnancy has always been a known risk factor, but other studies left it unclear whether light drinking posed a significant risk.
The report released Monday detailed the evidence against alcohol consumption and said that the only way to minimize risk is to abstain.
The study concluded the risk of Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders is at least 12 times as likely to lead to a birth defect if the mother consumes alcohol at any point during the pregnancy than for those who do not.
The lowest risk was associated with drinking in the first trimester, but the risk factor increases to over 60 percent for alcohol consumption in the second and third trimesters.
AAP calls alcohol-related defects the No. 1 preventable cause of developmental disabilities and can affect organ development, sensory perception and the spine in infants.
Consuming even a limited amount of alcohol was considered to be dangerous with the risk factor only increasing as the amount of alcohol consumed increased.
The AAP also reported surveys show 8 percent of women admit to drinking while pregnant.
